bug.summary: wandb.watch(model): unwatch and rewatch models with new parameters, using Hugging Face
bug.description:
wandb --version && python --version && uname wandb, version 0.9.3 Python 3.6.8 :: Anaconda, Inc. Darwin <denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
I was trying to unwatch models and rewatch them with new parameters. I am using the huggingface library which uses wandb. <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>wandb.unwatch() self._setup_wandb() </denchmark-code>
self._setup_wandb() is defined basically as: <denchmark-code> wandb.watch( self.model, log=os.getenv("WANDB_WATCH", "gradients"), log_freq=max(100, self.args.logging_steps) ) </denchmark-code>
Now, looking into unwatch/unhook in the wandb code: <denchmark-code> def unhook_all(self): for handle in self._hook_handles.values(): handle.remove() self._hook_handles = []
def unhook(self, name): handle = self._hook_handles.pop(name) handle.remove()
</denchmark-code>
This is wrong, it seems that at some point self._hook_handles was changed to a dictionary, so unhook/unhook all should be something like: <denchmark-code> def unhook_all(self): for handle in self._hook_handles.values(): handle.remove() self._hook_handles = {}
def unhook(self, name): handle = self._hook_handles[name] handle.remove()
</denchmark-code>
I havent tried this yet but I'll get back to it if I do.

Hi Pedro, thanks for diving in to the code, <denchmark-link:https://github.com/borisdayma>@borisdayma</denchmark-link> could you take a look? As for un-watching and re-watching a model, it sounds like you're editing the model during training, is that right? I'd recommend calling wandb.init() to start a new run each time you want to watch a model with new parameters
I can confirm issues with wandb.unwatch method. Maybe we should wait for the new CLI?

Hi there, the fixed code I think solved the problem (no longer a missing get), but as you said, there needs to be another init or else an exception is thrown that the watcher should be reinitialized with a copy. Is there any reason that you couldn't just add a watch to the new parameters? I am sure there are some internal logistics with references etc. What I am doing is just changing the requires_grad of a few existing parameters at a certain iteration.
